Dear L’vette Ramsey:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately please contact the area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but
not limited to: (iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member is verbally inappropriate towards an 18-year-old
youth at the facility regarding their sexual orientation. On 6/25/24,
the staff member made inappropriate comments regarding the
youth's genitals.
Investigation Interviews:
On 7/08/2024 a telephone call was made to Complainant without
success. A voicemail message was left requesting a return call
with any additional information relative to the concerns.
On 07/08/2024 a telephone call was made to Foster Care Worker
of Youth A. A message was left to return the call regarding Youth
A.
On 07/08/2024 Special Investigation was initiated with Consumer
Rights Officer of Visita Maria during a video conference call. He
informed me of a report that was called in and I confirmed that it
had been assigned to me for investigation. The allegations were
discussed.
On 07/09/2024 an onsite visit was made to Visita Maria. An
interview was completed with the Consumer Rights Officer. He
advised that Staff 1 had been terminated after the agency’s
internal investigation. He provided copies of the verification of
termination, the incident report and agency policy. He further
advised that Staff 2 reported she heard Staff 1 refer to Youth A as
“it” and stated it was because Youth A was confused regarding
her gender.
On 07/09/2024 an interview of Youth A at Vista Maria was
completed. She reported that she was on the wing in Rose Hall
and Staff 1 was referring to her as “it”. She stated that Staff 1
says it all the time and she has asked her not to. She confirmed
that Staff 2 was present and heard Staff 1 refer to her as “it”.
2

Youth A reported she came out of her room and asked Staff 1 to
stop calling her “it” and that it was disrespectful. Youth A denied
that other staff have called her names and reported that she feels
supported by other staff.
On 07/09/2024 an interview of Youth B at Vista Maria was
completed. She reported that she heard Staff 1 refer to Youth A
as “it”. She reported that she has heard it on more than one
occasion. She denied knowledge of any other staff being present
and denied that other staff have referred to Youth A as “it” or
called her any names. She further reported she heard Youth A
ask Staff 1 not to call her “it” and that the staff responded, “I don’t
have to listen to you, I’m grown”.
On 07/16/2024 and 08/05/2024 telephone calls were made to
Staff 1 without success. A message was left requesting a return
phone call. Staff 1 was terminated from Vista Maria effective
7/3/2024.
On 08/05/2024 a voicemail message was left for Staff 2
requesting a return call. Another telephone call was made to Staff
2 on 9/17/2024. She reported Youth A told her that she does not
want to deal with Staff 1 because she referred to her as “it”. Staff
2 reported that she addressed the issue with Staff 1 and told her
that she should not do that, but Staff 1 did not seem to care. Staff
1 stated that she called Youth A “it” because Youth A was
confused about her gender. Staff 2 confirmed that she never
heard Staff 1 refer to Youth A as “it” but reiterated that Staff 1
admitted to her that she said it.
Documents reviewed:
Vista Maria Harassment Policy – Policy indicates that Vista
Maria does not tolerate verbal or physical conduct by any
employee who harasses, disrupts, or interferes with another
person’s work performance, who creates an intimidating, offensive
or hostile environment, and who makes submitting to such
conduct an implicit or explicit condition of employment. Likewise,
Vista Maria will not tolerate an employee’s harassment of a client.
Analysis The agency is found to be in non-compliance with the licensing
rule. Both staff and youth were interviewed, and at the conclusion
of the investigation there was sufficient evidence to support that
the staff had utilized negative and humiliating language toward the
youth.
Conclusion Violation Established
3

Rule Code Program Statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following: (c)
Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care, safety, and
supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Additional Findings
Type
Allegation On 6/25/24, staff member called their boyfriend on speaker phone
to involve the boyfriend in the inappropriate conversation with the
youth present.
Investigation Interviews:
On 07/09/2024 an interview of Youth A at Vista Maria was
completed. She reported Staff 1 contacted a male that she
believed was Staff 1’s boyfriend during work time. She reported
he was placed on speaker phone and asked inappropriate
questions about the look of the vaginal area of Staff 1. Youth A
was advised that incident reports indicate that Staff 1 has reported
she saw pictures of her vaginal area in her cell phone. Youth A
denied seeing any inappropriate pictures of Staff 1 in her cell
phone or anywhere else.
On 07/09/2024 an interview of Youth B at Vista Maria was
completed. She denied knowledge of Staff 1 utilizing her
cellphone during work hours to contact her boyfriend. She also
denied seeing any inappropriate pictures of Staff 1 in her cell
phone or anywhere else.
On 07/16/2024 and 08/05/2024 telephone calls were made to
Staff 1 without success. A message was left requesting a return
phone call.
On 09/17/2024 a telephone call was made to Staff 2. She
reported Staff 1 told her Youth A targets her because some time
ago Youth A and her peers (who were unnamed) saw pictures of
the private area of Staff 1 in her phone and as a result Youth A
has stated that her private area was “pretty and pierced”. Staff 1
told Staff 2 that to prove that Youth A was a liar, she called her
boyfriend and put him on speaker, and he confirmed that she does
4

not have a piercing. She denied that she was present when Staff
1 made a call during work hours and placed the call on speaker.
Document Review:
Vista Maria Employee Behavior Policy: Policy indicates that
the following behaviors are prohibited: Personal cell phone use is
only permitted during scheduled breaks and are not allowed while
in the presence of clients in any residential program.
Vista Maria Incident Report (IR) #237 – IR was written by Staff
2. In summary the IR documented that Staff 2 reported that Staff
1 told her that she called her “boyfriend” and placed him on
speaker phone while in the wing with clients and another
unnamed peer.
HR File of Staff 2: Confirmed disciplinary action of Staff 1. She
received a verbal warning for attendance 9/2023 and was
terminated on 7/3/2024 for violation of employee behavior policy.
Analysis The agency is found to be in non-compliance with the licensing
rule. Both staff and youth were interviewed, and at the conclusion
of the investigation there was sufficient evidence to support that
the staff violated the policy and engaged in the use of her
personal cell phone while on duty which is a violation of agency
policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
